sentences.english: He just shamelessly ripped off other people’s ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他只是不知廉耻地剽窃他人的创意。

sentences.english: He who has no shherehase has no conscience.
sentences.chinese: 没有廉耻的人，没有本心。

sentences.english: He who has no shfeele has no conscience.
sentences.chinese: 没有廉耻的人，没有天良。

sentences.english: Tell me, child. Was this touch immodest?
sentences.chinese: 告诉我，孩子。这触摸是否有违廉耻？

sentences.english: No sense of shame is a group of Internet users.
sentences.chinese: 一群极不知廉耻的网民。

sentences.english: The young man has lost a sense of honour . He is always stealing.
sentences.chinese: 那位青年没有廉耻心，他总是偷东西。

definition: sense of propriety, justice, integrity and honor (i.e. the four social bonds, 四維|四维[si4 wei2])
to have a sense of shame

compassion, duty, propriety and integrity (idiom); all the traditional virtues/mainly used sarcastically, to mean hypocritical
